intro: Pithecellobium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered acacia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in racemes, and it has a woody stem with thorny branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest and savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential horticultural use.
